data.title: Great Home made pastas and sauces
data.text: Family run small space restaurant in Broomfield. Does a huge takeout and catering business. There are several tables for sit down customers. Friendly service and really good food.

data.title: Homemade goodness!
data.text: This great little place was a real treat. It's rare to get the fantastic thick spaghetti noodles in other places. Plenty of delicious red sauce and good garlic bread. Only disappointment was the side salad that was mostly iceberg lettuce but hey, I didn't come here for salad. Highly recommend this place and will return.

data.title: Great thick pasta.
data.text: The dine in isn't what it use to be in the old location but the pasta is still great. I always recommend the thick pasta with sauce.

data.title: Family restaurant, come for the food!
data.text: Very simple and small restaurant. All home made and awesome! Lunch specials all week long. Doubt you'll be disappointed!

data.title: Small family business, food made with heart.
data.text:
Grabbed a spaghetti dinner meal last week from this place that fed two of us into a coma.

Amazing, thick, and homemade spaghetti that my extremely anti "long noodle" girlfriend fell in love with. Meatballs were amazing, sausage was great (meatballs were better) and the garlic bread was... well... like 
damn son, where'd you find this.

18 bucks to stuff two people to the gill with leftovers. And your money goes into the pockets of a hard working local family business.

I suggest this place as a carry out, family dinner night at home any time you're not feeling cooking it yourself. Prima

data.title: The BEST homemade Spaghetti!
data.text: My husband's favorite Italian takeout place.  We only order the family size spaghetti and have enough for lunches for two more days.  Homemade, comes with garlic bread and salad.

data.title: Simple, Casual, Delicious
data.text: The choices on the menu aren't all that fancy like some Italian eateries. For the most part they appear fairly straight-forward--spaghetti, ravioli, lasagna, gnocchi. They also offer a variety of yummy sandwiches. The food is excellent. The pasta is homemade and cooked just as it should be cooked. The meatballs were fantastic. The garlic bread was soft and light and crunchy all at the same time. The dinner salad was nothing spectacular and neither were the onion rings but why did I even order onion rings at an Italian restaurant?  I ought to use my noggin!  The sauces were wonderful. We will definitely be coming back. I don't usually eat much Italian food since it's so heavy, but the next time I'm craving it we will head in this direction.

data.title: Great Local Place
data.text:
I started going here when my son was very young.  I introduced him to gnocchi and he was hooked.
The spaghetti noodles are thick and the sauce is delicious.  I'm glad they were able to re-open because it can be a great family tradition to go there.

data.title: done right, truly homemade
data.text: do you ever say to yourself why do people say that the meals they serve have been home made? well i can say that this place is as close to homemade as it claims, all the pasta, all the sauces all the sausages are truly made from scratch, worth more then the menu price, and friendly family owners will always be on hand to say hello to you as you walk into the door

data.title: Excellent homemade Italian
data.text:
Not a fancy place - I think they are encouraging take-out at their new location.  Seating is very limited.  The people are nice and friendly, but the restaurant is very basic.

The pasta is excellent - thick homemade spaghetti and wonderful gnocchi, but the best thing is their sauce - slightly spicy and very rich! Their pizza is really good too - rich flavor, good ingredients, quality cheese.  The garlic bread is strong and tasty.  About the only thing they do poorly is their salad (iceberg lettuce mostly).

The new location is hard to see from Nickel street - it's around the side of the shopette on the south - facing 3rd street.

data.title: Good homemade spaghetti.
data.text: Cozy, nice and quiet for familys.  I like their spaghetti and sauce.  Service is fast and friendly.  Didn't look specifically for poor kitchen cleanliness,  didn't see anything that was a concern.

data.title: A long time favorite, but not a clean place :-(
data.text:
We've been eating at Papa Frank's for YEARS - back in the old location on 120th Avenue and most recently in the new location on Nickel.  The food is delicious and the service downright friendly, but the staff just do not observe general rules of kitchen cleanliness.  It is sad.

We tried to eat at Papa Frank's a few weeks ago.  There was a short wait, so we hung out outside and we decided to watch the prep work - bad decision.  We observed that the kitchen staff do not wear hats or hair coverings, do not wear gloves, do not frequently wash hands and do not obseve general kitchen food safety rules.  Yes the food is REALLY GOOD - but the food handling is really gross.  I am sad to say that unless they cover their hair, wear gloves and pay better attention in the kitchen, we will not go back.
